metadata.title: Stock Service
metadata.description: Track guru portfolios and market trends at a glance

exchange.NASDAQ:
The heart of global tech and innovation.
Led by big tech companies, it reflects tech stock trends first.
exchange.NYSE:
World's largest traditional stock exchange.
Focused on proven blue-chip stocks in finance, energy, etc.
exchange.KOSPI:
Korea's main market of leading corporations.
Relatively stable with less volatility; driven by institutional and foreign investor flows.
exchange.KOSDAQ:
Korea's venture/tech growth market.
Small-to-mid cap companies with high growth potential; a high-risk, high-return market.

index.^IXIC:
NASDAQ Composite Index.
The key indicator of overall US tech stock trends.
index.^KS11:
KOSPI Index.
Reflects the overall trend of Korea's large-cap market.
index.^KQ11:
KOSDAQ Index.
Reflects the trend of Korea's tech and growth market.

sector.informationTechnology:
Semiconductors, software, IT services
The core industry driving tech innovation, sensitive to AI and cloud trends.
sector.healthCare:
Pharma, biotech, medical devices
Huge upside from drug breakthroughs, but high failure risk. Essential in an aging society.
sector.financials:
Banks, insurance, securities
Manages capital flows, sensitive to interest rates. Slow growth but high dividends.
sector.consumerDiscretionary:
Autos, luxury, hotels
Thrives when the economy booms, first to suffer in downturns.
sector.communicationServices:
Telecom, media, entertainment
Content and platforms are key, generating revenue through digital ads and subscriptions.
sector.industrials:
Construction, machinery, aerospace, defense
Strong during economic recovery, influenced by infrastructure spending and defense budgets.
sector.consumerStaples:
Food, beverages, household goods
Steady demand regardless of economy, popular as a defensive investment with stable dividends.
sector.energy:
Oil, gas, renewables
Stock prices swing heavily with oil prices. Green transition trends are also key.
sector.materials:
Chemicals, steel, metals
Produces raw materials for manufacturing, tends to rally first during economic recovery.
sector.utilities:
Electric, gas, water
Monopolistic structure with stable revenue and high dividends, but low growth potential.
sector.realEstate:
REITs, building leases
Owns property and earns rental income. Favored when rates drop; many offer monthly dividends.
